copied_ledger.title: Story Beat: Copied Ledger
copied_ledger.text: Copies move faster than knives. The city wakes to an idea: the fights were fixed, the names are named, and the sand remembers everything.

public_exposure.title: Story Beat: Public Exposure
public_exposure.text: Arena gates splinter; the crowd learns its roar had been purchased. Anger finds a direction. It points at the podium.

act1_intermission.title: Intermission: The Breathing Room
act1_intermission.text: A single night without a contract. Cassian wraps his hands in silence and counts the people he can still trust on one hand. It does not require all his fingers.

act2_intermission.title: Intermission: Ledger in the Wind
act2_intermission.text: Pages move across taverns and shrines. Everyone claims to have a copy; few can read the numbers. The rumor is more dangerous than the evidence.

act3_intermission.title: Intermission: Before the Gate
act3_intermission.text: The city holds its breath. Factions wait for Cassian to choose a banner. He tightens his greaves and wonders who will write the version of the story that survives.

Cult.title: Ending: Cult Ascendant
Cult.text: Incense floods the arena tunnels. The crowd chants a name that is not a god but becomes one anyway. Cassian is lifted on shoulders that tremble with belief and hunger.

State.title: Ending: State Restored
State.text: The ledger vanishes into sealed archives. Marcellus bows; the magistrates smile thinly. Cassian signs a confession he does not read and is granted clemency that feels like exile.

Solo.title: Ending: Alone Beyond the Walls
Solo.text: No banner, no blessing. Cassian walks east with a broken spear and a ledger page folded in his boot. Behind him, a city argues about whether he ever existed.

epilogue_rhesus.title: Epilogue: Rhesus
epilogue_rhesus.text: Rhesus keeps fighting long after the crowd forgets the ledger. He shouts Cassian's name before every bout, daring the house to fix the odds again.

epilogue_iona.title: Epilogue: Iona
epilogue_iona.text: Shrine braziers burn late. Iona rewrites the litany to include refusal as a sacrament. Pilgrims leave with ash on their brows and names of officials in their pockets.

epilogue_moth.title: Epilogue: Moth
epilogue_moth.text: Moth sells copies of the ledger for a coin apiece. Most are blank parchment. The story is worth more than accuracy.

epilogue_varro.title: Epilogue: Varro
epilogue_varro.text: Varro balances new ledgers with old debts. He keeps one empty page open, waiting for the next gladiator who learns to say no.

epilogue_solo.title: Epilogue: Quiet Road
epilogue_solo.text: There is a road where no one knows Cassian’s name. He walks it until the ledger’s ink smears and the memories become weather.
